column4: When I boot up Ubuntu, It asks for a Keyring password to connect to the internet (madwifi). Is there a way I can make it so I don't have to type in my account password?
it shouldve unlocked the keyring when you logged in if the passwords match... or do you have automatic login turned on?
ok, acknowledging that this is rather insecure...  if you go to applications -> accessories -> passwords & encryption keys, and go to the "login keyring" you can reset the password to blank
